intro: Lasinia pallens, commonly known as the pale lasinia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, silvery or pale green pubescence. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom during the warmer months.
